metadata.titel_preek: Season After Pentecost: Trinity Sunday & Psalm 130

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God, whose inner nature is self-giving love, pursues and redeems a humanity that is in a state of 'primordial catastrophe' and self-destruction.

subject.identificatie: The Triune God (Father, Son, Holy Spirit)
tekstueel_bewijs: God pursues us even beyond the grave
The love that persists in breaking through our resistance
He shall redeem Israel from all his iniquities

object.identificatie: Redemption and the restoration of the 'miserable offender' to fellowship

zender.identificatie: The Triune Nature of God (Internal necessity of Love)
tekstueel_bewijs: whose nature it is to give that love to his creatures without restraint

ontvanger.identificatie: The 'Miserable Offender' / The Church (Corinthians and Hearers)

helper.identificatie: Jesus Christ (Incarnation/Blood) and the Holy Spirit
tekstueel_bewijs: spends itself to the very last drop of the blood of the Son
conveyed to you a measure of the love of God

tegenstander.identificatie: Sin as a 'Vast Primordial Catastrophe' and Human Resistance
tekstueel_bewijs: depths of human pride, disobedience, perversity
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: Sin is described not as a mistake but as an ontological 'catastrophe' that makes human standing impossible.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The human response of confession and 'fear of the Lord' as a result of being found by grace.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Hearer/Psalmist
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program (human response) is explicitly triggered by the primary program (divine forgiveness).

voorbeelden_god_subject: God pursues us even beyond the grave
The love that persists in breaking through our resistance
voorbeelden_mens_subject: the psalmist is enabled to raise up his eyes

voorbeelden: things which we ought to have done
God... whose nature it is to give
understand what is meant here by the fear of the Lord
total inability to present ourselves righteous

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on human 'non-pouvoir' (inability) met by Divine 'pouvoir' (sovereign power to save).

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From S2 (The Depths) through ~S2 (Confession) to S1 (Grace).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by the character of God (S1) who acts because S2 is insurmountable for the human subject.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; S2 is described as a 'primordial catastrophe'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon consistently places God as the active Subject and humanity as the desperate Receiver. It avoids moralism by emphasizing human inability.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: Think about those people who have borne with you.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: God pursues us even beyond the grave

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Human figures (parents/Paul) are used as 'hints' or 'glimmers' of God, not as models to be imitated for salvation.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Theocentric: Paul's agony reflects God's agony over the lost.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and 'renewed confidence' through external rescue.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the Trinity's nature to the human need in Psalm 130 is logically and theologically seamless.
spanning_punten: The tension between 'miserable offender' and 'beloved child'.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: God’s love spends itself to the very last drop of the blood of the Son.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit provides the 'fellowship' and 'conveys' the love that the human cannot generate.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is a textbook example of a theocentric narrative where God is the Subject of all transformative verbs.

modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: The current balance effectively kills legalism.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This sermon masterfully avoids the 'exemplarist trap' by framing human love only as a signpost to the divine Subject.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While rhetoric would focus on the 'parent' metaphor's emotional appeal, semiotics shows the metaphor functions to define God's actantial role as the desperate seeker.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains the Trinity; semiotics reveals the Trinity as a 'dynamic interrelatedness' that acts as the Sender of grace.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas reveals that the 'fear of the Lord' is not a Devoir (obligation) but a result of the Subject's (God) Performance (forgiveness).

appendices.notities: The sermon uses Fleming Rutledge's own logic (quoting her 'primordial catastrophe') to maintain a high grace-orientation.
